decision_conditions: <p>LANDSCAPING:&nbsp;The hedge between No.9 Oldfield Close and No.1 Winscombe Way shall be planted as shown on the drawings, within the first planting season from the date of this decision notice. Any existing or new trees or shrubs which, within a period of 5 years from the completion of the development, die, are removed, or become seriously damaged or diseased, shall be replaced in the next planting season, with others of a similar size and species, unless the local authority agrees any variation in writing.</p>

The window(s) in the flank elevation(s) of the proposed development shall:
(a) be of purpose-made obscure glass,
(b) be permanently fixed closed below a height of 1.7m above finished floor level,
and shall thereafter be retained in that form.

The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and documents:&nbsp;<span style="line-height: normal;">PL01 rev A; PL02 rev A; PL04 rev C; PL05 rev D; PL06 rev D; PL07 rev C; Location Plan; Incoming letter (24th August 2023); Reasonable Exception Statement</span>
The roof area of the extension hereby permitted shall not be used as a balcony, roof garden or similar amenity area without the grant of further specific permission from the local planning authority.

Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that order with or without modification), no window(s)/door(s), other than those shown on the approved plans shall be installed in the flank elevation(s) of the development hereby permitted without the prior permission in writing of the local planning authority.
description: Retention of Rear Dormer and Ground Floor Rear Extension; Alteration to Facade
